instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes when running graphics test
threads.message: I read up a bit on this issue and found that the issue is usually from a failure at <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>. I checked voltage there and get 1.57, should be 1.8v correct? I have replaced the IC with a larger 330 one, but I still get the same 1.57v. Could it be pulled down by a short in the GPU?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes when running graphics test
threads.message: Look at schematic and see that it can switch between 1.5 and 1.8V. If it still crashes after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> then in the trash it should go.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes when running graphics test
threads.message: Replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> and running fine now, thanks!
